meanings.sent1: The rose outblooms the daisy in the garden.
meanings.sent2: The sunflower always outblooms the other flowers in the field.
meanings.sent3: The tulip challenged the daisy to a blooming contest, but the tulip outblooms every time!
meanings.sent4: Her smile outblooms the brightest flowers in the garden.
meanings.sent5: The cherry blossom outblooms all other trees with its beauty.

meanings.definition: To bloom more than something else.
meanings.sent1: In spring, the cherry tree outblooms the apple tree.
meanings.sent2: The daffodils always outblooms the tulips in our garden.
meanings.sent3: The competition between the two flowers was fierce, but the daisy outblooms the rose every year!
meanings.sent4: Her talent outblooms all others in the music industry.
meanings.sent5: The fireworks display outblooms the city skyline on New Year's Eve.
